content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a 12year legal case the court partially reformed the judgment made by the court of prato in 2004 it declared that a savings account jointly owned by the deceased person referred to as bv and their son referred to as ben had a half credit balance the court also declared that ben and bv were coheirs and required to contribute to the deceased persons estate which included a small house in prato the court rejected the main claim and counterclaim made by bv and ben and stated that the court costs were fully compensated bv appealed the decision requesting that ben contribute to the inheritance without dividing it the court explained the difference between collation and division and clarified that collation deals with individual assets the court determined that half of the credit balance in the savings account belonged to the estate and the other half to the legal heirs bvs claim for collation of a property in calenzano was rejected due to lack of evidence but a small villa in prato was deemed subject to collation bens counterclaim for collation of assets acquired with the deceaseds financial help was also rejected due to lack of evidence the court divided the costs of the case placing half on the defendant in the final ruling the court confirmed the half credit balance in the savings account and declared ben as a coheir required to contribute to the estate the court ordered the appellants and crossappellants including ben to pay the remaining half of the court costs the decision was made in florence on july 7 2006

metadata.CASE_ID: Corte appello Firenze sez. I, 30/10/2006, n.1743
